alert.note: Alert for Juniata; Perry (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 07 at 9:18AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Juniata and Perry. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 916 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated areas of heavy rain. Localized minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Localized rainfall amounts of between 1 and 3 inches has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Honey Grove, Spruce Hill, Mexico, East Waterford, Walnut, Ickesburg, Colonel Denning State Park, Loysville, Perulack, Blacklog, Big Spring State Park, Mifflintown, Port Royal, Mifflin, Blain and New Germantown. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
